text:
Hello there. 

We have started design thoughts (themes) a few weeks back. It got to a halt due to adidas’s workload … When do you think is a good time to pick up on it again. What has changed or is likely to change. When would we need a different design alternatives (at least 'on paper’)?
Good question, don’t have an answer this moment. But the industrial design of the cap and the hub is a great unknown.
I’m working on determining the hardware necessary so I can do a board design to which I can export a model to fusion 360
but I’m at best weeks away from that
all that being said, im happy to work with you on it now

Also, we are putting together a grant proposal, so if we were going to use any specific materials (beyond 3D printing) those would be great to know. Proposal due 12/6, so understand that might not be enough time, but if you do have some things you've been noodling on, it would be great to get the government to pay for them eheh
I think if there's down time and we can use this as an opportunity to learn about Fusion 360 then let's try it out.
Josh bought some licenses on Friday

Thanks for the answers. Looks like the final design solution isn’t super urgent, but i would not want to let it slip either. <@U0B9N0HF0> at this point i cannot make any material suggestions apart from it most likely not being 3D printed? 
Metal where it can be used? Wood? High quality plastics … rubber parts … real cork ... It’s all in the mix.

<@U0K8ZSHN0> when doing board design, what are you thriving for? I guess going smaller is one, but if you need volume, is it going ‘high’ like current or ‘wide’? Or does it get significantly smaller so its just one board … Happy to discuss in person
The intent is to have it all on one circular board with a battery below it. I would love for the caps to be metal but I’m not sure how that will effect the RF signal transmission.
If we can get away with making 100k units with this grant, then we might want to go the injection molded route.
cheers Lee, if i think metal i thought that it can be used partially, taking RF into account …
shape and size matter, CNC some housings, then test in RF chamber
